resources.string:
Ayia Napa is a resort at the far eastern end of the southern coast of Cyprus. The name Ayia Napa is derived from a Venetian-era monastery of the same name, located in the centre of the town, next to the square that today is the clubbing centre. The word "Ayia" (Agia) means "holy" in Greek. "Napa" is archaic and means "wooded valley" or dell.

It is visited by hundreds of thousands of tourists every summer season. During the summer, the tourists in Ayia Napa are enjoying the sunny days and the numerous sandy beaches.

Moreover, it has some of the best night life in Europe!! There ia a wide choice of clubs and over seventy bars - there is something for everyone in Ayia Napa. Whether you are looking for a beach holiday, a fun family break or going solo, it is a getaway for all tastes and types. It is packed with bars, clubs and entertainment to suit every taste and budget.
